intro: Aetheolaena mojandensis, commonly known as the Mojandoan sandbush, is a shrub native to the arid regions of northern South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, branching structure and gray-green foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the dry season. It is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation, making it a resilient species in harsh environments. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for local fauna.
